meanings.definition: A person who believes in the strict, literal interpretation of religious texts.
meanings.sent1: The fundamentalists in our community attend church every Sunday without fail.
meanings.sent2: The fundamentalists at the mosque follow the teachings of the Quran closely.
meanings.sent3: The fundamentalists organized a bake sale to raise funds for their church.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the cause made her stand out like a fundamentalist in a crowd of doubters.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fundamentalists praying together left a lasting impression on me.

meanings.definition: A member of a religious movement characterized by a strict adherence to fundamental beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The fundamentalists in the congregation always wore traditional attire.
meanings.sent2: The fundamentalists in the monastery followed a strict daily routine.
meanings.sent3: The fundamentalists decided to have a picnic to celebrate their unity.
meanings.sent4: His commitment to the cause was as unwavering as a fundamentalist's faith.
meanings.sent5: The fundamentalists' dedication to their beliefs was evident in their actions.

meanings.definition: A person who is uncompromising in their beliefs or principles.
meanings.sent1: The fundamentalists refused to change their stance on the issue.
meanings.sent2: The fundamentalists stood firm in their convictions despite opposition.
meanings.sent3: The fundamentalists' stubbornness sometimes led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as that of a fundamentalist defending their faith.
meanings.sent5: The fundamentalists' unwavering dedication inspired others to stay true to their values.
